# DSAE  MLaaS Container Chain Builder
# The following variables are needed to configure the run of the container
# Autogenerated file: Do not modify for testing and debugs.
#=====================================================================================
# Run Type: Set value to demo for demontrstation. Set to initialize for install run
#of the container else set to default for production run. If setting to demo or
# initialize in run type the container should have access to internet for download
# of necessary packages. Proxy for internet is picked either from OS environment
# variables or from docker config.
mlaasapp021_runtype=demo
# Run Mode: Set value to debug to run self-test else set to default
mlaasapp021_runmode=default
# The application setting for Web services log level. Set as one of the following:
# [debug, info, warning, error, critical] Default log level is info.
mlaasapp021_w3gloglevel='info'
# The application setting for Web services call timeout in seconds. Set as one of the following:
# Default is set to 10 minutes
mlaasapp021_w3glogtimeout=600
# The application setting for Flowcontroller services log level. Set as one of the following:
# [info, critical] Default log level is critical.
mlaasapp021_fcloglevel='critical'
# Set the import directory for Container SSL configuration.
# The SSL folder should contain the following three files:
# server.crt - Certificate file generated by your CA for this container.
# server.key - Certificate key file generated by your CA against the certificate file.
# serverca.crt - The CA Certificate file to be trusted for API Calls and Authentication.
# condassl.crt - The conda SSL cert file to be used to verify conda package downloads.
#                Use this option if you are behind a revrse proxy.
# certifiadd.crt - Add certificates for other resources like github or pypi repo which
#                might be needed to execute your package install list. Be carefull about
#                adding unknown or public certificates from internet.
mlaasapp021_ssldir=$PWD/imports/clientssl
# Only change the following defaults if you follow a strict naming convention of secure
#certificate files for complaince. Modify the dfault to reflect the new file names.
mlaasapp021_sslcacert=serverca.crt
mlaasapp021_sslservercert=server.crt
mlaasapp021_sslserverkey=server.key
mlaasapp021_sslcondacert=condassl.crt
mlaasapp021_sslcertificert=certifiadd.crt
# Set the Flag for import of ssl certificates. Set True for SSL Import and False to
# skip the import.
mlaasapp021_importssl=True
mlaasapp021_importcondassl=True
mlaasapp021_importcertifissl=True
# Provide IP addess assigned to the container
mlaasapp021_ip=172.17.0.2
# Provide verifiable hostname assigned to the container
mlaasapp021_hostname=sieascioapp019
# Provide entry point exposure port assigned to the container
mlaasapp021_port=8081
# Providee host docker version
mlaasapp021_dockerver=19.03.12
# System proxy variables
HTTP_PROXY=
HTTPS_PROXY=
NO_PROXY=localhost, 127.0.0.1, sieascioapp019
##########################################################################
# MLaaS Container Factory Encryption Keys at image
# Warning:  System Generated Keys - DO Not Modify !
mlaasapp021_emodule_key="xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx"
#mlaasapp021_emodule_key='xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx'
mlaasapp021_dmodule_key="xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx"
#mlaasapp021_dmodule_key='xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx'
mlaasapp021_imodule_key="xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx"
#mlaasapp021_imodule_key='xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx'
mlaasapp021_cmodule_key="" # -- Console
mlaasapp021_amodule_key="" # -- Adminstrative
##########################################################################
# End of Daily Run - MLaaS Container Factory Queue C02 #
